logic.simulator
Class AbstractPokerHandSimulator

java.lang.Object
  logic.simulator.AbstractPokerHandSimulator
Direct Known Subclasses:
PokerHandSimulatorOriginal, PokerHandSimulatorVersion2
public abstract class AbstractPokerHandSimulator
extends java.lang.Object

Simulates the result when pitting poker hands against each other. Implementations of this class must implement the createBestHands-method. There the implementation can specify how the best hands for a starting hand are to be found.

Constructor Detail

AbstractPokerHandSimulator

public AbstractPokerHandSimulator(java.util.List<AbstractStartingHand> startingHands,
                                  java.util.List<Card> boardCards,
                                  int numberOfSimulations)
Creates a new hand simulator with the given starting hands and board cards.

Parameters:
startingHands - List of starting hands
boardCards - List of board cards.
numberOfSimulations - Number of simulations.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfSimulations isn't positive
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there are less than two startingHands.

AbstractPokerHandSimulator

public AbstractPokerHandSimulator(java.util.List<AbstractStartingHand> startingHands,
                                  int numberOfSimulations)
Creates a new hand simulator without any board cards. The board will be used in the simulation if the given starting hands have a game type with uses community cards.

Parameters:
startingHands - List of starting hands
numberOfSimulations - Number of simulations.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfSimulations isn't positive
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there are less than two startingHands.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if hands or the board have overlapping cards.
Method Detail

verifyHandsAndBoard

private void verifyHandsAndBoard()
Verifies that the starting hands and the board do not have overlapping cards.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if overlapping cards are found.

addCardsFromStartingHandsToRemovedCards

private void addCardsFromStartingHandsToRemovedCards()
Adding all cards from the starting hands to the list removedCards. This is done so that we don't retrieve these cards from the deck when simulating. If any board cards are given as input, they are added to this list too in the constructor.

performSimulation

public SimulationResult performSimulation()
Performs the desired simulation. The class will simulate the result the amount of times requested in the constructor. This method does not use threads.

Returns:
SimulationResult-object containing the results of the simulation.

performSimulation

public SimulationResult performSimulation(int numberOfThreads)
                                   throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Performs the desired simulation. The class will simulate the result the amount of times requested in the constructor. This method uses parallel threads to perform the simulations.

Parameters:
numberOfThreads - Number of threads to use.
Returns:
SimulationResult-object containing the results of the simulation.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of threads is non-positive and larger than 16.
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the threads are interrupted.

simulateHand

protected java.util.Set<AbstractStartingHand> simulateHand()
Simulates a hand. If there isn't a tie for the best hand, the list only contains one element: the index of the winning hand in the startingHands-list. If there's a tie, the list contains the indices for the winning hands.

Returns:
set containing the winning hand(s).

copyOfBoard

protected FiveCardBoard copyOfBoard()
Copies the boardcards given in the constructor

Returns:
Copied board.

createBestHands

protected abstract void createBestHands(java.util.List<FiveCardPokerHand> allBestHands,
                                        java.util.Map<FiveCardPokerHand,java.util.List<AbstractStartingHand>> bestFiveCardHandForStartingHand,
                                        FiveCardBoard simulatedBoard,
                                        java.util.List<AbstractStartingHand> simulatedHands)
Determines the best possible hand for the startingHands in this simulation.

Parameters:
allBestHands - All best hands are added to this list
bestFiveCardHandForStartingHand - Maps five card hands to starting hands for which the five card hand hand is the best hand.
simulatedBoard - A full simulated board
simulatedHands - Filled starting hands.

simulateBoard

protected FiveCardBoard simulateBoard(ICardDeck deck)
                               throws java.lang.RuntimeException
Simulates the board.

Parameters:
deck - Card deck
Returns:
Simulated full board.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - If the deck runs out of cards.

fillStartingHands

protected java.util.List<AbstractStartingHand> fillStartingHands(ICardDeck deck)
Creates copies of starting hands and fills them. The filled copy of a hand is found at the same place in the startinghands-list and in the returned list.

Returns:
List of AbstractStartingHand-objects with the same game type and cards as the hands in the startingHands-list.
